did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Mary B. Kegley Miscellaneous Documents Collection 1860-1908

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Mary B. Kegley Miscellaneous Documents Collection, Mss. Collection 2008.4, Kegley Library, Wytheville Community College, Wytheville, VA

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary B. Kegley in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The artificial collection consists of documents collected by historian Mary B. Kegley from various sources and include legal agreements, a letter, summons, and promissory notes.
Rental of house lately occupied by William Archer, the stable and garden attached and owned by W. A. Stuart and Joseph Kent. Rented by Isaac Eversole and Henry Wohlford for $2.25 per month.

Land formerly occupied by Nathan Henley and wife by a deed of trust with Joseph Kent dated 21 January 1858. Kent notified that he would sell the land on 13 March 1874 to the highest bidder at public auction. Land was 100 acres that adjoined land of George W. Gleaves.

did.unittitle: Letter. Rees T. Bowen, Knob Post Office, Tazewell County, Virginia to Albert [unknown]. 20 May 1891.

scopecontent.p: Re: receipt of check for $100.00 and desire for him to visit with cousin Sallie and the girls and the illness of his son, Thompson Crockett Bowen.

did.unittitle: Summons. F. J. Lundy, Clerk of Court, Grayson County, Virginia to J. F. Porter, Clark Porter, Alexander Porter, Martha Stringer and Bynum Porter. 9 March 1901.

scopecontent.p: Re: to answer bill filed against them by S. M. Greer, Shirley Lunsford, and F. C. Young for themselves and creditors of J. F. Porter.

did.unittitle: Promissory note. N. P. Rickey to J. R. Hudson, Wytheville, Virginia. 1 February 1902.

scopecontent.p: Note for $150.00 payable to Bank of Wytheville.

did.unittitle: Promissory note. W. J. Price to N. C. James. 10 October 1908.

scopecontent.p: Note for $150.00 payable to Bank of Speedwell.
Note for $100.00 payable to Bank of Speedwell.
